topic.label: Click this and look right
topic.detail:
Click an item on the left pane to view its details on the right pane.

It is a bit like turning cards face up in the game of Pairs (aka Memory or Concentration) -- just that it won't cost you scores. 'Turn' as often as you need.

topic.label: Move
topic.detail:
To move an icon, drag it, i.e., press and hold the left mouse-button, move the mouse-pointer, and release the mouse-button.

Do that to move similar items close to each other.

topic.label: Connect
topic.detail:
To connect one icon to a second icon, you will ALT + drag it, i.e.
- point at the first icon,
- press and hold the ALT key,
- then drag the mouse until you reach the second icon,
- then release both the mouse-button and the ALT key.

Exercise: Connect the 'ALT + drag' icon to some related icon.

topic.label: Pan
topic.detail:
To pan the canvas, drag its background.

Try it! Does it work?

topic.label: Drop input
topic.detail:
The easiest way to get your input into the map is
- to select some text in another window
- and just drag and drop it onto the canvas.

Just try it (except on Safari & IE). Don't be confused by the unexpected shapes of the mouse pointer -- once the mouse is over the canvas, it will change.

topic.label: Drop a file
topic.detail: You may drop a simple text file onto the canvas (except on Safai). Each line becomes an item.You may separate the 'detail' part from the 'label' by a TAB character.

topic.label: Add single items
topic.detail:
Right-click the canvas and select 'Add a new item here', then fill in the 'Label' and/ or 'Details' fields.
In the (limited) demo version, press 'Done' after editing.

Single icons are useful if you want to create 'towns' amidst the 'villages' on your thought map. But unlike categories, they don't even need a name!

topic.label: Wipe
topic.detail:
Right-click the canvas and select 'Wipe clean'.

This limited map is like a blackboard in a classroom: When you re-open your browser tomorrow, you will still see the drawings that you left here today. (They live in the browser's cache database.)
For new maps, wipe clean. Perhaps export them first.

(The full version supports filing as you would expect it.)

topic.label: Export
topic.detail: Right-click the canvas and select 'Export' to get an .xml file that can be opened in the full Condensr version (free download here:condensr.de).

topic.label: Re-color
topic.detail: Right-click an icon, and select a new color.

topic.label: Drag
topic.detail: Drag an icon to move it. Drag the canvas background to pan.

topic.label: ALT + drag
topic.detail: ALT + drag an icon to connect it.
